feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS AND HIGH SURF FOR THE KUSKOKWIM BAY COAST SUNDAY... An upper level disturbance will promote enhanced west to southwesterly winds early Sunday into Sunday afternoon. Sustained winds of 30 to 40 mph are forecast to overspread the Kuskokwim Bay and coast beginning Sunday morning. High surf 1 to 2 feet above the normal highest tide line is possible and may cause minor
entry.cap:areaDesc: Kuskokwim Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:48PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Sunday Night Through Monday... North to northwest winds will increase Sunday night into Monday, resulting in elevated surf. Waves will wash up near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and belongings left on the beach could wash away.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chukchi Sea Coast

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:48PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Along Eastern Norton Sound Sunday Through Monday... Strong west to northwest winds Sunday into Monday are expected to cause elevated surf along the Norton Sounds Coast Sunday into Monday. Waves to wash near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:48PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Along the Yukon Delta Coast Tonight And Again Sunday Afternoon Through Monday... Strong southwest to west winds tonight are expected to cause elevated surf tonight along the Yukon Delta. Winds shift to the northwest Sunday afternoon and increase again. Waves will wash near the top of the beach. Minor beach erosion may occur and
entry.cap:areaDesc: Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:43PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Cool And Wet Into Next Week... Northern Alaska is now in a cool and wet pattern that will last through next week. This will bring periods of snow to areas of the Interior above 3000 ft this weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Denali; Eastern Alaska Range; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 06 at 2:40PM AKDT until August 07 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT SUNDAY... * LOCATION...Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast. * TIMING...Until Noon Sunday. * IMPACTS...Beach erosion will occur. Belongings left on the beach may wash away. Logs and debris will wash up on to the beach.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Beaufort Sea Coast

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued August 06 at 2:38PM AKDT until August 07 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches are expected above 3000 feet, with 1 to 2 inches from 2000 to 3000 feet.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northeastern Brooks Range
